#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail

# Constants (uppercase for constants/globals)
readonly BACKUP_DIR="/backup"
readonly LOG_FILE="/var/log/backup.log"
readonly MAX_BACKUPS=7

# Logging function
log() {
    local level="$1"
    shift
    echo "[$(date +'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')] [$level] $*" | tee -a "$LOG_FILE"
}

# Error handling function
error_exit() {
    log "ERROR" "$1"
    exit "${2:-1}"  # Exit code defaults to 1
}

# Success message function
success() {
    log "INFO" "$*"
}

# Check if running as root
require_root() {
    if [[ $EUID -ne 0 ]]; then
        error_exit "This script must be run as root" 1
    fi
}

# Create backup
create_backup() {
    local source="$1"
    local dest="$2"
    
    log "INFO" "Creating backup of $source to $dest"
    
    if tar czf "$dest" "$source" 2>/dev/null; then
        local size
        size=$(du -h "$dest" | cut -f1)
        success "Backup created successfully ($size)"
        return 0
    else
        error_exit "Failed to create backup" 1
    fi
}

# Clean old backups
clean_old_backups() {
    log "INFO" "Cleaning backups older than $MAX_BACKUPS days"
    
    local old_backups
    old_backups=$(find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "backup_*.tar.gz" -mtime +"$MAX_BACKUPS")
    
    if [[ -n "$old_backups" ]]; then
        echo "$old_backups" | while read -r file; do
            log "INFO" "Deleting old backup: $file"
            rm "$file"
        done
    else
        log "INFO" "No old backups to clean"
    fi
}

# Main function
main() {
    require_root
    
    local date_stamp
    date_stamp=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)
    local backup_file="$BACKUP_DIR/backup_$date_stamp.tar.gz"
    
    mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"
    
    create_backup "/var/www" "$backup_file"
    clean_old_backups
    
    success "Backup process completed successfully"
}

# Run main function
main "$@"
EOF

#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail

# Temporary file
TEMP_FILE=$(mktemp)

# Cleanup function
cleanup() {
    local exit_code=$?
    echo "Cleaning up..."
    rm -f "$TEMP_FILE"
    if [[ $exit_code -ne 0 ]]; then
        echo "Script failed with exit code $exit_code"
    fi
    exit $exit_code
}

# Register cleanup on exit (normal or error)
trap cleanup EXIT
trap cleanup INT TERM

echo "Working with temporary file: $TEMP_FILE"
echo "Some data" > "$TEMP_FILE"

# Simulate error
if [[ "${1:-}" == "--fail" ]]; then
    echo "Simulating failure..."
    false  # This will trigger cleanup
fi

echo "Script completed successfully"
EOF

#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail

# Default values
VERBOSE=false
OUTPUT_DIR="."
INPUT_FILE=""

# Usage function
usage() {
    cat << USAGE
Usage: $(basename "$0") [OPTIONS] -i INPUT_FILE

Process a file with various options.

OPTIONS:
    -i, --input FILE     Input file (required)
    -o, --output DIR     Output directory (default: current directory)
    -v, --verbose        Enable verbose mode
    -h, --help           Show this help message

EXAMPLES:
    $(basename "$0") -i input.txt
    $(basename "$0") -i input.txt -o /output -v
USAGE
    exit 1
}

# Parse arguments
while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
    case "$1" in
        -i|--input)
            INPUT_FILE="$2"
            shift 2
            ;;
        -o|--output)
            OUTPUT_DIR="$2"
            shift 2
            ;;
        -v|--verbose)
            VERBOSE=true
            shift
            ;;
        -h|--help)
            usage
            ;;
        *)
            echo "ERROR: Unknown option: $1" >&2
            usage
            ;;
    esac
done

# Validate required arguments
if [[ -z "$INPUT_FILE" ]]; then
    echo "ERROR: Input file is required" >&2
    usage
fi

if [[ ! -f "$INPUT_FILE" ]]; then
    echo "ERROR: Input file does not exist: $INPUT_FILE" >&2
    exit 1
fi

# Verbose logging
log_verbose() {
    if [[ "$VERBOSE" == true ]]; then
        echo "[VERBOSE] $*"
    fi
}

# Main logic
log_verbose "Input file: $INPUT_FILE"
log_verbose "Output directory: $OUTPUT_DIR"
log_verbose "Processing file..."

echo "Processing: $INPUT_FILE"
echo "Output will be saved to: $OUTPUT_DIR"
echo "SUCCESS: File processed"
EOF
